d9c5a960-6e1c-411f-8eef-ce208425bfbc.description: The Pinnacle Badge is designed to recognize earners for outstanding achievement across disciplines and represents a broad array of hard and soft skills attained during the course of their education. While primarily designed for earners who have finished a significant amount of their program, it is also designed for those outstanding students who performed consistently high resume-worthy achievements within a single class who are not necessarily degree-seeking students. (Per Program Description.)
d9c5a960-6e1c-411f-8eef-ce208425bfbc.name: The Pinnacle Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Alaska Fairbanks

alignments.name: Level 3: Validation
alignments.description: Validation: represents demonstrated skill in a high-stakes environment. Earning Criteria: Statement of learning and types of assessment that includes a cut score, a third-party examination and is linked to an artifact of learning.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has demonstrated a consistently high level of performance throughout their program of study or individual courses, as measured through learning outcomes and applicable rubrics that are relevant to the industry the course/program serves (Except in rare circumstances, such as ABUS F199 Applied Business Practicum or equivalent, individual courses should be at the 200 level or higher).
The earner has been, at a minimum, timely in the submission of all work, and the work represents extraordinary quality that stands out among their peers in the course or the program.

The earner has submitted an outstanding artifact that demonstrates an extraordinary level of achievement.  The criteria for an extraordinary level of achievement should be established through written criteria such as a rubric and tied to course/program learning outcomes.

Except in extenuating circumstances as deemed by the program, the earner must have earned an "A" in an individual course, with all course requirements having a minimum grade of a "B," and/or they must hold a minimum GPA of 3.0. (GPA Applicable to Degree Seeking Students Only)

Earner will present some form of evidence of service.  This can be demonstrated through volunteerism, community engagement, student organizations, or some other form of service deemed appropriate by the individual program.

d2fb47ba-61be-467f-b780-0256ceaa7d0e.description: Earners of the Applied Social Media Marketing Professional micro-credential will demonstrate a high degree of competency in social media marketing practices that connect with consumers, broaden customer reach, develop a brand, and achieve other marketing objectives across social media outlets. Individuals will have gained applicable knowledge in social media marketing and management for professional applications.
d2fb47ba-61be-467f-b780-0256ceaa7d0e.name: ABUS: Applied Social Media Marketing Professional

issuer.summary: issued by University of Alaska Fairbanks

alignments.name: Level 3: Validation
alignments.description: Validation: represents demonstrated skill in a high-stakes environment. Earning Criteria: Statement of learning and types of assessment that includes a cut score, a third-party examination and is linked to an artifact of learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete, with a "A" or better, ABUS F265 Current and Emerging Trends in Applied Marketing: Social Media Marketing course.  Click anywhere in this description to see a sample ABUS F265 syllabus.

Complete a Social Media Marketing Strategy with a grade of 90% or better. Click anywhere in this description for more information on "How to write a social media marketing plan" and the project checklist.

Successfully completes and passes Hootsuite Platform Certification and Social Marketing certification.  Earners will be required to make a 70% or better on a proctored examination to earn the certifications.  Click anywhere in this description for more information.

04ddce47-9fad-4852-a7ad-4a85055993c8.description: Earner has demonstrated mastery of basic, intermediate, and advanced Excel features through the attainment of 90% or better score on two capstone projects, thus receiving two badges from MyLabIT. In addition, the earner has demonstrated the ability to apply knowledge of Excel features to new material by authoring a final project in the CIOS F135 Excel course at the 'A' letter grade level as required by the final project rubric.
04ddce47-9fad-4852-a7ad-4a85055993c8.name: MS Excel 2019 Professional

issuer.summary: issued by University of Alaska Fairbanks

alignments.name: National Business Education (NBEA) Standards 2020, Information Technology, VII Applications
alignments.description: Apply advanced features of applications for productivity. Use applications to analyze data for making good business decisions. Design spreadsheets for workplace applications (e.g., formulas and functions, graphs and charts, links, macros)

badge_template_activities.title: Earner of MS Excel 2019 Introductory badge issued by MyLabIT. Student has demonstrated proficiency of Introductory Excel learning objectives by achieving a 90% or higher score on a MyLab IT Grader "Live-in-the-Application" Excel Capstone Project.

Earner of MS Excel 2019 Advanced badge issued by MyLabIT. Student has demonstrated proficiency of Advanced Excel learning objectives by achieving a 90% or higher score on a MyLab IT Grader "Live-in-the-Application" Excel Comprehensive CapstoneProject.

Earner has created a final project with a letter grade of 'A' in the CIOS F135 Excel Spreadsheets course at UAF Community & Technical College. Student will have incorporated at least 36 Excel features chosen from a rubric into a project that is meaningful and professional.

c6b5dc26-adbb-4876-a590-887f463b6384.description: Basic understanding of, and performing automotive vehicle checks, vehicle lubrication and maintenance tasks, under-vehicle inspections, and 4-stroke theory and operation.
c6b5dc26-adbb-4876-a590-887f463b6384.name: Basic Auto Diagnostics and Maintenance

issuer.summary: issued by University of Alaska Fairbanks

alignments.name: Validation
alignments.description: Represents: Demonstrated skill in a high-stakes assessment. Earning Criteria: Statement of learning and types of assessment that includes a cut score, a third-party examination and is linked to an artifact of learning.

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this digital credential, you must receive an evaluation of 3 or higher in each of the 24 skills competencies.  You will also be evaluated, daily, on your attendance, participation and classroom engagement.

40d0ae36-f0dd-4cb7-bc01-34d6c4ae32df.description: The Alaska Interior Business Accelerator (AIBA) validates skills and knowledge for existing small businesses and aspiring entrepreneurs through a series of presentations, networking opportunities, and applied exercises. Selected participants will learn how to build a successful business model, perform market research, identify customer segments, and financing for a business. In addition, participants will have mentorship opportunities from industry experts.
40d0ae36-f0dd-4cb7-bc01-34d6c4ae32df.name: Alaska Interior Business Accelerator

issuer.summary: issued by University of Alaska Fairbanks

badge_template_activities.title: 10 competitively selected participants attended eight 2 - hour weekly sessions. During which, there were lectures on various aspects of business, engaging and relevant business exercises, creation of a business model canvas. In addition, participants developed and delivered a business "pitch" to fellow participants and contributors with the Alaska Interior Business Accelerator. From this event, a select few participants were invited to pitch at the weekly Fairbanks Chamber of Commerce lunch.

82e2cdf9-bff4-460f-9797-3310eeec1eeb.description: This course focuses on building key employability and career development skills for work. Students will gain confidence, skills, and networking opportunities to better prepare them for success in the workplace.
82e2cdf9-bff4-460f-9797-3310eeec1eeb.name: ABUS: Employability Skills

issuer.summary: issued by University of Alaska Fairbanks

alignments.name: Level 3: Validation
alignments.description: Validation: represents demonstrated skill in a high-stakes environment. Earning Criteria: Statement of learning and types of assessment that includes a cut score, a third-party examination and is linked to an artifact of learning.

badge_template_activities.title: YES! Employability Skills Certification Students who complete all ABUS F183 Professional Skills for the Job Hunt assignments are eligible to receive a YES! Employability Skills Certification from the Alaska Safety Alliance.
Complete Professional Portfolio. Requires you to participate in a mock interview, and submission of final cover letter and resume.

Complete Employability Skills Plan. The plan will evaluate your learning and experience in this course.  You will be required to discuss how well you are prepared for the workforce, areas of improvement, and what steps you will take to improve in the future.

Community Member Review.  Upon completion of your Professional Portfolio you will connect with a Community Mentor to review your materials.  You will submit your mentor's review as well as a review of yourself.

e77a2215-57cc-4cae-beaa-4d1113b2f418.description: Earners of this badge will demonstrate developmentally appropriate practice through hands-on experiences with young children using strategies such as positive verbal skills. Study includes research, interviews, artistic, written and oral reports. Individual goals are established based on the Alaska SEED ECE career ladder.
e77a2215-57cc-4cae-beaa-4d1113b2f418.name: Early Care and Education Career Exploration

issuer.summary: issued by University of Alaska Fairbanks

alignments.name: National Association for the Education of Young Children

badge_template_activities.title: Define these terms with 90% accuracy: Early Care and Education, Child Care, Preschool, Head Start, Child Development, Early Childhood Education, Nanny, Caregiver, EC Teacher, family home provider. (An individual 1-2 page written essay or poster)

Distinguish between these types of professional preparation with 100% accuracy: CDA, Occupational Endorsement, ECE Certificate, Associate of Arts general degree, Associate of Applied Science degree, Bachelor level degrees, Type A certified teaching credential, and the challenges and rewards of each. (A repeatable quiz)

Reflect on personal experiences as a young child, identifying approaches, resources, and feelings (Reflective journal entry, discussion or artistic opportunity for expression. Scored for participation or communication skills minimum 70%.)
Identify 4 aspects of “developmentally appropriate practice.” (Written oral essay with 100% accuracy)

Demonstrate positive communication skills by expanding on current relationships with young children, using positive verbal skills in hands-on experience with them. (Recorded session or report from an outside observer with 70% accuracy)
Research and report on 3 career options in ECE with 90% accuracy. Project may include computer search, interviews, and oral or artistic report. (May be completed as a group project)

skills.name: Define Roles And Terms In Early Childhood Education
Reflect On Personal Experiences In Education
Research Career Options In Early Childhood Education

8ce331fe-42ef-4857-a2bb-35d0ff3f1926.description: Entrepreneurship and management, starting a new business, buying an existing business or franchise. Managing, marketing, staffing, financing, budgeting, pricing, operational analysis, and controls.
8ce331fe-42ef-4857-a2bb-35d0ff3f1926.name: Entrepreneurship Level 1

issuer.summary: issued by University of Alaska Fairbanks

alignments.name: Entrepreneurship and Small Business
alignments.description: Successful completion of the Entrepreneurship and Small Business Certification (ESB) validates skills and knowledge for those students interested in working in a middle-skill trade profession as their own boss and those with entrepreneurship and small business career aspirations.

badge_template_activities.title: Entrepreneur Interview: You will interview an entrepreneur and follow a general “interview outline,” as well as develop individual questions.
Business Concept: You will develop a business concept based on personal business goals and submit a "what is your business idea?"
Business Model Canvas (BMC) You will develop a Business Model Canvas and create an oral "pitch" that communicates your business concept.
Model Marketing Canvas: You will develop a Marketing Model Canvas and create an oral "pitch" that communicates your business concept
Fiscal Checklist: You will conduct a quantitative Fiscal Checklist and communicate the results of the Checklist in a qualitative narrative summary.
To earn the Entrepreneurship Level 1 Badge you must earn a minimum of 90% in the course and a minimum of 90% on the Entrepreneurship and Small Business practice exam.
Complete and assemble ESB eBook and post to the Google Share Drive

c5323dc2-7a29-404d-bb13-d25d040396f8.description: Earners will demonstrate the ability to define fitness in terms of goals, behaviors, and activities. Earners will improve their health through physical education and activity while exploring a career in Early Care and Education by assisting young children in fitness activities.
c5323dc2-7a29-404d-bb13-d25d040396f8.name: Fitness for Early Care Teachers

issuer.summary: issued by University of Alaska Fairbanks

alignments.name: National Association for the Education of Young Children (NAEYC)

badge_template_activities.title: Communicate and reflect on personal experiences in fitness. Identify approaches, resources, feelings, goals about personal fitness. (Personal assessment form 100% completed and 80% participation in discussion of resources)
Satisfactorily complete research on current issues of concern for children's physical fitness in Alaska and the USA. (Reflective essay with 80% accuracy and discussion with 100% participation)

Personal fitness: Improve personal health through exploration and participation in a variety of fitness activities. (Fitness log tracking exercise levels scored at 70% for consistent and accurate entries)
Personal fitness: Demonstrate knowledge of Alaska Physical Education Standards for K-2. (Repeatable quiz completed with 70% accuracy)

Understanding relationships: Identify, reflect and build on current relationships with young children, while informally observing their level of physical development and skill. (Lab observations of children's physical activities for at least 90 minutes)

Career Exploration: Use Alaska State Early Learning Guidelines and other course resources to plan meaningful and challenging activities that enhance fitness for individual children in sensory awareness, large muscle & locomotion, balance, rhythm and fine motor skills. (Submit 5 lesson plans with 100% approval)
Appropriate practice teaching fitness. Implement approved plans in the 5 previously identified areas of fitness. (Written reflection on progress of each child with minimum score 80%)

2653344b-983d-469c-be15-40a1d074b55d.description: Earners will develop healthy nutrition strategies that support fitness and overall health. Earners will plan and teach nutrition activities with young children including awareness of food safety, the importance of eating a balanced diet, and nutrients for energy, growth, and regulation.
2653344b-983d-469c-be15-40a1d074b55d.name: Nutrition for Early Care Teachers

issuer.summary: issued by University of Alaska Fairbanks

alignments.name: National Association for the Education of Young Children (NAEYC)

badge_template_activities.title: Communication: Reflect on personal nutrition. (Personal nutrition assessment form 90% complete)
Communication: Research current issues on children's nutrition. (Reflective essay with 70% score)
Personal fitness: Improve health through exploration and participation in a variety of fitness activities (Fitness log tracking exercise levels at 70% completion)
Personal fitness: Demonstrate knowledge of resources for nutrition education. (Successful completion of application activities from the text with 70% accuracy)

Understanding relationships: Identify, reflect and build on current relationships with young children, while informally observing their nutrition. (Lab--observe children's interest and understanding of nutrition for at least 2 meals. Discussion with 100% participation)

Career exploration: Using course resources, plan activities that promote healthy meals and snacks for young children. Based on previous lab observation and information from the course, submit 5 plans for healthy meals that include activities for young children in each of the following areas of nutrition: eating a balanced diet, food safety, and nutrients for energy, growth, and regulation. (100% approval)
Teaching nutrition: Using previously approved plans, student will lead young children in 5 separate nutrition activities at different times in the course. (80% completion required)
Appropriate practice: Evaluate effectiveness of nutrition lessons. Document children's nutritional awareness before and after each of the 5 activities. (Written report with a score of 70%)

skills.name: Child Care And Adult Food Program

55c4f9cd-8851-4ebb-8e05-27c88e40f599.description: Culmination of three part series. Earners must have earned the Early Childhood Education Fitness for Teachers and Nutrition for Teachers badges. Earners will improve overall physical wellness by making long lasting lifestyle changes.
55c4f9cd-8851-4ebb-8e05-27c88e40f599.name: Wellness for Teachers

issuer.summary: issued by University of Alaska Fairbanks

alignments.name: National Association for the Education of Young Children

badge_template_activities.title: Analyze current health and lifestyle practices relative to physical activity and nutrition. Describe the importance of personal health to successful teaching. (Reflective essay scored at 70%)

Identify and institute personal activities to achieve measurable goals. Establish a schedule and a means to track progress. ( Maintain a log for about 10 weeks showing both fitness activities and nutrition progress).
Evaluate the success of the plan. Compare previously identified goals to the progress shown in log documentation. (Written report with 70%)
Fitness for Early Care Teachers
Nutrition for Early Care Teachers
